ms86.name: Center of Mass and Momentum Conservation (Collision)

questions.body:
The wave function, ψn, l, ml is a mathematical function whose value depends upon spherical polar coordinates r, θ, ϕ of the electron and characterized by the quantum numbers n, l and ml . Here r is distance from nucleus, θ is colatitude and ϕ is azimuth. In the mathematical functions given in the Table, Z is atomic number and ao is Bohr radius
 
Column – 1 Column – 2 Column – 3
(I) Is orbital (i) ψn, l, ml ∝Zao32 e-Zreo (P)
(II) 2s orbital (ii) One radial node (Q) Probability density at nucleus ∝1ao3
(III) 2pz orbital (iii) ψn, l, ml ∝Zao52re-Zr2aocos⁡θ (R) Probability density is maximum at nucleus
(IV) 3dz2 orbital (iv) xy -plane is a nodal plane (S) Energy needed to excite electron from n = 2 state to n = 4 state is 2732 times the energy needed to excite electron from n = 2 state to n = 6 state
For hydrogen atom, the only CORRECT combination is

explanation.en:
We have to select only correct combination hence, the option (iv) is correct.

For 1s orbital : ψn,l,m αZa032 e-zra0

Energy needed to excite : from n = 2 to n = 4

ΔE2-4=13.6 Z2×316eV

Energy needed to excite from : n = 2 to n = 6

ΔE2-6=13.6 Z2×836

ΔE2-4=2732 E2-6  (hence,true)

questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.body: Which of the following is(are) true statement regarding free radical bromination of an alkane?

answers.body: Transition state for H abstraction in propagation step is closer to reactant than product in terms of potential energy
It occur with difficulty as compared to chlorination but a highly selective reaction
Transition state for H abstraction in propagation step is closer to product than reactant in terms of potential energy
It occur rapidly but very less selectively

body.en: It occur with difficulty as compared to chlorination but a highly selective reaction

explanation.en:
Bromination is less reactive but highly selective.

Bromination product is less stable, comes closer to transition state in terms of potential energy.

body.en: Transition state for H abstraction in propagation step is closer to product than reactant in terms of potential energy

explanation.en:
Bromination is less reactive but highly selective.

Bromination product is less stable, comes closer to transition state in terms of potential energy.

questions.body:
Let ∫sin32θ+cos32θdθsin3θcos3θsinθ+α=2secαfθ-2cosecαgθ+c , where α is an arbitrary constant then

माना ∫sin32θ+cos32θdθsin3θcos3θsinθ+α=2secαfθ-2cosecαgθ+c , जहाँ α एक स्वैच्छिक नियतांक है, तब


The possible value(s) of f(α) + g(α) is/are
f(α) + g(α) का/के संभावित मान है/हैं

explanation.en:
Substitute expression in tanθ.
∫sin32θ+cos32θdθsin3θcos3θsinθ+α
⇒  ∫sin32θ dθsin32θcos3θ⋅sinθcosα+cosθsinα+∫cos32θ dθcos32θsin3θsinθcosα+cosθsinα
⇒ ∫dθcos2θtanθcosα+sinαI1+  ∫dθsin2θcosα+cosθsinαI2
For I1 put tanθ cosα + sinα = t2
⇒ cosα sec2θ dθ = 2t dt
For I2 put cosα + cotθ sinα = μ2
⇒ –cosec2θ·sinα dθ = 2μ dμ
⇒ ∫2t dtcosα⋅t-∫2μ dμsinα μ
⇒ 2secαsinα+tanθcosα-2cosecα
cosα+cotθsinα+c
∴ f(θ) = sinα + cosα tanθ
and g(θ) = cosα + cotθ sinα
f(α) = 2sinα ∈ (0, 2)
g(α) = 2cosα
⇒  fα+gα∈2 ,  22

tanθ में व्यंजक प्रतिस्थापित करने पर
हल :
∫sin32θ+cos32θdθsin3θcos3θsinθ+α

⇒ ∫dθcos2θtanθcosα+sinαI1+  ∫dθsin2θcosα+cosθsinαI2

⇒ cosα sec2θ dθ = 2t dt
I2 के लिए, cosα + cotθ sinα = μ2 मान रखने पर
⇒ –cosec2θ·sinα dθ = 2μ dμ
⇒  ∫2t dtcosα⋅t-∫2μ dμsinα μ
⇒  2secαsinα+tanθcosα-2cosecα
cosα+cotθsinα+c
∴ f(θ) = sinα + cosα tanθ
और g(θ) = cosα + cotθ sinα
f(α) = 2sinα ∈ (0, 2)
g(α) = 2cosα
⇒  fα+gα∈2 ,  22

Substitute expression in tanθ.
∫sin32θ+cos32θdθsin3θcos3θsinθ+α

cosα+cotθsinα+c

and g(θ) = cosα + cotθ sinα

questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.body: No. of sigma bonds in A is n. Then n 8 ?

explanation.en:
20 + 2 + 1H = 2 4

n = 24

n 8 = 2 4 8 = 3

questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.body: Find the minimum equivalent resistance that can be obtained by three resistance <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle mathsize="14px"><mn>2</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi><mo>,</mo><mo> </mo><mn>3</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></mstyle></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle mathsize="14px"><mn>6</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></mstyle></math>.

explanation.en:
Given,           R1=2 Ω

                     R2=3 Ω

                     R3=6 Ω

When we combine the resistors in parallel, the equivalent resistance is lesser than the value of the resistance of the individual resistors.

When resistors are connected in parallel, the equivalent resistance is given by

So 1R=1R1+1R2+1R3

     1R=12+13+16=3+2+16=66=1 Ω

questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.body:
Match the following:
  Column I   Column II
A.  n = 6  → n = 3 (H-atom) P.  10 lines in the spectrum
B.  n = 7  → n = 3 (In H-atom) Q.  Spectral lines in visible region
C.  n = 5  → n = 2 (In H-atom) R.  6 lines in spectrum
D.  n = 5  → n = 1 (In H-atom) S.  Spectral lines in infrared region
    T.  Spectral lines in UV region

explanation.en:
A ⇒ 6 - 3 6 - 3 + 1 2 = 6 Lines, I.R.Region 3,4

B ⇒ 7 - 3 7 - 3 + 1 2 = 1 0 Lines, I.R.Region 1,4

C ⇒ 5 - 2 5 - 2 + 1 2 = 6 Lines, visible Region I.R. 2,3,4

D ⇒ 5 - 1 5 - 1 + 1 2 = 1 0 Lines, U.V, visible + I.R.Region 1,2,4,5

questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.body:
Assertion : When dry air is passed continuously through an aqueous solution of a non-volatile solute, vapour pressure of solution decreases gradually.

Reason : Some air is absorbed in the solution.

answers.body: Both assertion and reason are correct and reason is correct explanation of assertion.
Both assertion and reason are correct but reason is not the correct explanation of assertion.
Assertion is correct but reason is wrong.
Assertion is wrong but reason is correct.

body.en: Both assertion and reason are correct but reason is not the correct explanation of assertion.

explanation.en: Both assertion and reason are factually true. However, decrease in vapour pressure is the result of loss of solvent from vapour phase as air is bubbled through solution.

questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.body: Mechanical energy is converted into electrical energy by an electric generator.

explanation.en: Mechanical energy is converted into electrical energy by an electric generator. This mechanism is based on electromagnetic induction.

The region in shown shaded right side of the line x+y=0

4+12= 52

= 52 2 .

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.primary_concept: Distance of a Point from a Line

questions.body: A foot of the normal from the point (4, 3) to a circle is (2, 1) and a diameter of the circle has the equation 2x - y - 2 = 0. Then the equation of the circle is :

explanation.en:
Diameter of the circle is given as

        2x - y - 2 = 0                  ...(i)

slope of  PN : 3 - 1 4 - 2 = 1

equation of normal through PN is


       


y - 1 = (x - 2)

x - y - 1 = 0                            ...(ii)

solving (i) and (ii), centre is (1, 0)

Hence equation of the circle is

(x - 1)2 + y2 = (2 - 1)2 + 1

x2 + y2 - 2x - 1 = 0

questions.body: Area of the region bounded by the curve <math> <mrow> <mtext>y</mtext> <mo>=</mo> <msup> <mtext>e</mtext> <mtext>x</mtext> </msup> </mrow> </math> and lines x = 0 and y = e is

explanation.en:
Shaded area = e - ∫ 0 1 e x dx = 1

Also,  ∫ 1 e  ln e + 1 - y dy

              put  e + 1 - y= t ⇒ - dy = dt



4 = ∫ e 1  ln  t - dt = ∫ 1 e  ln  t  dt

   = ∫ 1 e  ln  y  dy = 1

Shaded area = e - ∫ 0 1 e x dx = 1

Also,  ∫ 1 e  ln e + 1 - y dy

              put  e + 1 - y= t ⇒ - dy = dt



4 = ∫ e 1  ln  t - dt = ∫ 1 e  ln  t  dt

   = ∫ 1 e  ln  y  dy = 1

Shaded area = e - ∫ 0 1 e x dx = 1

Also,  ∫ 1 e  ln e + 1 - y dy

              put  e + 1 - y= t ⇒ - dy = dt



4 = ∫ e 1  ln  t - dt = ∫ 1 e  ln  t  dt

   = ∫ 1 e  ln  y  dy = 1

questions.body: If <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mrow><munderover><mo stretchy="false">∫</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">π</mi></mrow><mo>/</mo><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mrow></mrow></munderover><mrow><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">tan</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">x</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></math> , then -

explanation.en:
In=∫0π/4tann⁡xdx

In=∫0π/4tann-2⁡x sec2⁡x- 1 dx=∫0π/4tann-2⁡x sec2⁡xdx - ∫0π/4tann-2⁡xdx

In=tann-1⁡xn-10π/4- In-2⇒ In+In- 2=1n-1⇒A is correct ... (1)

Replace n by n+1

Then, In+1+In- 1=1n⇒ B is correct

Now in interval 0,π4 tann⁡x < tann-2⁡x

= ∫0π/4tann⁡dx < ∫0π/4tann-2⁡x dx⇒ In < In- 2

⇒ In < 1n-1- In from (1)

2In < 1n-1⇒ and In+2 < In⇒ 1n+1- In < In

⇒ 1n+1 < 2In

From (1) and (2) we get 1n+1 < 2In < 1n-1

In=∫0π/4tann⁡xdx

In=∫0π/4tann-2⁡x sec2⁡x- 1 dx=∫0π/4tann-2⁡x sec2⁡xdx - ∫0π/4tann-2⁡xdx

In=tann-1⁡xn-10π/4- In-2⇒ In+In- 2=1n-1⇒A is correct ... (1)

Replace n by n+1

Then, In+1+In- 1=1n⇒ B is correct

Now in interval 0,π4 tann⁡x < tann-2⁡x

= ∫0π/4tann⁡dx < ∫0π/4tann-2⁡x dx⇒ In < In- 2

⇒ In < 1n-1- In from (1)

2In < 1n-1⇒ and In+2 < In⇒ 1n+1- In < In

⇒ 1n+1 < 2In

From (1) and (2) we get 1n+1 < 2In < 1n-1

In=∫0π/4tann⁡xdx

In=∫0π/4tann-2⁡x sec2⁡x- 1 dx=∫0π/4tann-2⁡x sec2⁡xdx - ∫0π/4tann-2⁡xdx

In=tann-1⁡xn-10π/4- In-2⇒ In+In- 2=1n-1⇒A is correct ... (1)

Replace n by n+1

Then, In+1+In- 1=1n⇒ B is correct

Now in interval 0,π4 tann⁡x < tann-2⁡x

= ∫0π/4tann⁡dx < ∫0π/4tann-2⁡x dx⇒ In < In- 2

⇒ In < 1n-1- In from (1)

2In < 1n-1⇒ and In+2 < In⇒ 1n+1- In < In

⇒ 1n+1 < 2In

From (1) and (2) we get 1n+1 < 2In < 1n-1

questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.body: If the function  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">f</mi><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">x</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msup></math>  and  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">x</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">x</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> , then the value of  <math><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">′</mi></mrow></msup><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>  is equal to ____.

explanation.en:
f′x=3x2+12ex2, f0=1

We have, f′0=12

⇒fgx=x

⇒f′gx.g′x=1

⇒f′f1.g′1=1

⇒g′1=112=2

questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.body:
Match the following
 
Column – I Column - II
(a) fx=  x⁡ 3 is (p) Continuous in (-1, 1)
(b) fx= x is (q) Differentiable in (-1, 1)
(c) fx=sin-1⁡x is (r) Differentiable in (0, 1)
(d) fx=cos-1⁡x is (s) Not differentiable at least one point in (-1, 1)

explanation.en:
(i) fx=x3 is continuous and differentiable

(ii) fx= x is continuous

f′x=12x .xx , does not exist at x=0

(iii) fx=sin-1⁡x is continuous

f′x=sin-1⁡xsin-1⁡x .11-x2 does not exist at x=0

(iv) fx=cos-1⁡x is continuous

questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.body: An astronomical telescope has an eyepiece of focal length 5 cm. If the angular magnification in normal adjustment is - 10, the distance between the objective and eyepiece in cm is

explanation.en:
m = - f⁡ 0 f⁡ e = - 1 0

f⁡ 0 = 5 0 cm

e = f⁡ 0 + f⁡ e = 5 5 cm

questions.subject: Physics

questions.body: A particle is moving on a circular arc AB as shown in figure. The centripetal force acting on the particle is found to be π/3 N. Then

answers.body: The power delivered by this force is positive
The power delivered by this force is zero
Average force on particle during motion is <math><mn>2</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math>
Average force on particle during motion is <math><mn>1</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math>

body.en: Average force on particle during motion is <math><mn>1</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math>

explanation.en:
Duration of motion=πR3v

∴ <F> = |P→2-P→1|t = mv(πR/3v)=1N

Centripetal force is always perpendicular to velocity. Hence power delivered by this force is zero.

body.en: The power delivered by this force is zero

explanation.en:
Duration of motion=πR3v

∴ <F> = |P→2-P→1|t = mv(πR/3v)=1N

Centripetal force is always perpendicular to velocity. Hence power delivered by this force is zero.

questions.subject: Physics

questions.body:
For Next Three Question

Figure shows a potentiometer with a cell of 2.0 V and resistance 0.40 Ω  maintaining a potential drop across the resistor wire AB. A standard cell which maintains a constant emf of 1.02 V (for very moderate currents upto a few mA) gives a balance point at 60 cm length of the wire. To ensure very low currents drawn from the standard cell, a very high resistance of 600 k Ω  is put in series with it, which is shorted close to the balance point. The standard cell is then replaced by a cell of unknown emf ε  and the balance point found similarly, turns out to be at 80 cm length of the wire.



The value of emf of the unknown cell ε  is

explanation.en:
<math>
<mrow>
  <mfrac>
    <mrow>
      <mtext>E</mtext>
    </mrow>
    <mrow>
      <mn>1</mn>
      <mo>·</mo>
      <mn>0</mn>
      <mn>2</mn>
    </mrow>
  </mfrac>
  <mo>=</mo>
  <mfrac>
    <mrow>
      <mn>8</mn>
      <mn>0</mn>
    </mrow>
    <mrow>
      <mn>6</mn>
      <mn>0</mn>
    </mrow>
  </mfrac>
  <mo>⇒</mo>
  <mtext>E</mtext>
  <mo>=</mo>
  <mn>1</mn>
  <mo>·</mo>
  <mn>3</mn>
  <mn>6</mn>
  <mtext> V</mtext>
</mrow>
</math>

questions.subject: Physics

questions.body:
Figure shows a potentiometer with a cell of 2.0 V and resistance 0.40 Ω  maintaining a potential drop across the resistor wire AB. A standard cell which maintains a constant emf of 1.02 V (for very moderate currents upto a few mA) gives a balance point at 60 cm length of the wire. To ensure very low currents drawn from the standard cell, a very high resistance of 600 k Ω  is put in series with it, which is shorted close to the balance point. The standard cell is then replaced by a cell of unknown emf ε  and the balance point found similarly, turns out to be at 80 cm length of the wire.



Would the method work in the above situation if the driver cell of the potentiometer had an emf of 1.0 V instead of 2.0 V ?

answers.body: Yes only if the driver cell is ideal in nature.
Yes but the value of high resistance (600 <math> <mrow> <mtext>k</mtext> <mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi> </mrow> </math>) must be lowered.
No as the driver cell has lower emf as compared to the unknown cell.
Yes it will work perfectly and no modification is needed to be done in the circuit.

body.en: No as the driver cell has lower emf as compared to the unknown cell.

explanation.en: Potentiometer does not work if e.m.f. of driver cell is less than unknown voltage.

questions.subject: Physics

questions.body:
Figure shows a potentiometer with a cell of 2.0 V and resistance 0.40 Ω  maintaining a potential drop across the resistor wire AB. A standard cell which maintains a constant emf of 1.02 V (for very moderate currents upto a few mA) gives a balance point at 60 cm length of the wire. To ensure very low currents drawn from the standard cell, a very high resistance of 600 k Ω  is put in series with it, which is shorted close to the balance point. The standard cell is then replaced by a cell of unknown emf ε  and the balance point found similarly, turns out to be at 80 cm length of the wire.



Would the circuit work well for determining an extremely small emf, say of the order of a few mV (such as the typical emf of a thermo-couple) ?

answers.body: Yes, with the same accuracy and with no further modification.
No, as the balanced wheat stone bridge will not form with the lower emf of unknown cell.
Yes, but by connecting using suitable resistance in series with the driver cell.

Yes, but with reducing the high resistance <math> <mrow> <mfenced close=")" open="(" separators=","> <mrow> <mn>6</mn> <mn>0</mn> <mn>0</mn> <mtext> k</mtext> <mi>Ω</mi> </mrow> </mfenced> </mrow> </math> to a lower value.

body.en: Yes, but by connecting using suitable resistance in series with the driver cell.

explanation.en: To reduce the value of potential gradient (To read small e.m.f.), high resistance is connected in series with driver cell.

questions.subject: Physics

questions.body: A charged particle is in equilibrium at a height h = 1 m from a horizontal infinite line charge with uniform linear charge density. The charge lies in the vertical plane containing the line charge. If the particle is displaced slightly in vertical direction, find the time period of SHM in second. <math> <mrow> <mfenced close=")" open="(" separators=","> <mrow> <mi>π</mi> <mo>=</mo> <msqrt> <mn>1</mn> <mn>0</mn> </msqrt> </mrow> </mfenced> </mrow> </math>

explanation.en:
2 k λ h q = mg

dF = - 2 k λ h q h dh



T = 2 π h g

questions.subject: Physics
questions.primary_concept: Examples on Force on a dipole in the surrounding of a long charged wire

questions.body:
A homogenous field of magnetic induction B is perpendicular and into the plane of a sufficiently ling track of gauge length l (separation between tracks) which is inclined at an angle α to a horizontal. A conducting rod of mass 'm' slides on the two frictionless rails of the track as shown in the figure. The rod is released from rest. If the circuit formed by the rod and the track is closed by the moving switch of terminals 1, 2, 3 and 4. (Neglect the resistance every where except shown resistance)

Column – I (switch Position) Column – II (Effect)
(A) A resistor of resistance R (p) Rod moves with constant acceleration
(B) A capacitor of capacitance C (q) Rod moves with decreasing acceleration and finally attains a terminal velocity (constant)
(C) A coil of inductance L (r) Rod will perform simple harmonic motion about uniformly accelerated mean position
(D) An ideal cell of time varying emf E=B(gsin⁡α) t (s) Rod moves with constant velocity

explanation.en:
(A) In case of resistance (r) acceleration of rod, mg sin⁡α-iBl=ma

∴   a=gsin⁡α-iBlm

Also i=BvR  ∴   a=gsin⁡α-B2l2mRV  ∴   when a=0 ; V=gsin⁡αB2l2mR=constant

(B) In case of capacitance C : q=C Bv ⇒   i=dqdt=BCldvdt=BCa

∴   Again from Newton′s law :mgsin⁡α-BlCaBl=ma  ⇒a=gsin⁡α1+B2l2Cm=constant

(C) In case of inductance only (L): Ldidt=Bldxdt       ∴   Li=Blx, i=BlLx

∴   Again mgsin⁡α-ilB-ma ∴   a-gsin⁡α

- B2l2mL x   ⇒   a=-B2l2mL x+gsin⁡α

∴   equation of SHM 

(D) As induced emf in the rod is equal to external cell. So the current in the circuit is zero and hence it acceleration with gsin⁡α .

questions.subject: Physics

atg_data.instructions:
1. Total duration of this test is 60 minutes.
  2. There will be 21 Single Option Correct MCQ questions.
  3. There are 3 sections in the question paper consisting of Physics, Chemistry, Mathematics, having (Physics), (Chemistry), (Mathematics), questions respectively.
  4. Read instructions in each section before you attempt.
  5. To activate RankUp - Guaranteed improvement plan, you must spend atleast 30% of the time allocated to the test.

ms86.integer: In each section, question number 6 to 6 are Integer type questions.The answer to each of the questions is a single-digit integer, ranging from 0 to 9 (both inclusive). Each question carries 4 marks for correct answer and there is no negative mark for wrong answer.
ms86.linked comprehension: In each section, question number 3 to 5 are Linked Comprehension type questions. There are two comprehensions, based upon each comprehension, 2 single choice questions have to be answered. Each question has 4 answer choices (A), (B), (C) and (D), out of which only one is correct. Each question carries 4 marks for correct answer and  -1 marks for wrong answer.
ms86.matrix: In each section, question number 7 to 7 are Matrix type questions. Each question has two columns: (Column-I and Column-II). There are 4 statements (A), (B), (C) and (D) in Column-I and 5 statements (P), (Q), (R), (S), (T) in Column-II. Any given statement in Column-I can have correct matching with one or more statement(s) given in Column II. Each question carries 4 marks for correct answer and -1 mark for wrong answer. A partial of  4 mark is provided for correctly answering each statement of Column-I.
ms86.multiple choice: In each section, question number 2 to 2 are Multiple Choice questions. Each question has 4 answer choices (A), (B), (C) and (D), out of which one or more than one is/are correct. Each question carries 4 marks for correct answer and -1 marks for wrong answer. A partial of  4 mark is given for selecting each correct option, provided NO incorrect option is selected.
